job_title: Residential site manager in Alton, IL
pros: Good support system and help when needed
cons: Staff can be terrible depending on the house you are over.

review_title: Hard job made harder by poor management practices
pros: Reasonable pay for entry level position and you get to work with children 1:1 all day.
cons: Little support from management, poor work life balance, equivalent of 6 days of "unexcused absences" allowed per year (includes family/life emergencies and sick days unless you get a doctor's note). You are required to give management one month's notice of any PTO you may need, any later than that and it is unexcused and counts against you. ABA side is very understaffed and therapists are not able to provide consistent, quality support because they are spread so thin. I was repeatedly put in unsafe situations with little to no guidance on how to respond to client aggression. Client and employee injuries were almost never documented or taken seriously.

pros: The overall work environment is good and the BCBAs are nice and knowledgeable.
cons: As nice as BCBAs are, many are unprofessional and pick favorites. There is a lot of gossip behind the scenes.

pros: Nice kids and the BCBA’s work super hard
cons: Management is awful, they treat employees terribly

pros: Flexible schedule and paid lunch.

review_title: Nice Staff. Revolving door hiring process
pros: People. Clients. Training. Seeing progress.

job_title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst Bcba in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Great team! Everyone works well together.
cons: No cons at this time.

review_title: Good place Easy to get lost
pros: Great Job very rewarding. Work hard and they will bend over backwards to help you do well and succeed.  Very supportive office if you work hard and show you are committed and care about residents. They are doing the best they can with what little they have.
cons: Unfortunately company is growing rapidly and it's easy to get lost in the crowd. Lot's of downtime so you'll need to be careful as many of your coworkers will pass the time with gossip. Be very careful. No real chances for advancement without a degree. Pay is low.

pros: Very friendly and helpful staff and management, extremely rewarding working with such cute and unique kiddos, has staff recommendation box and recognizes workers hard work, can provide supervision for BCBA, let you do paid office work is client cancels
cons: Adjustment issues due to quick expansion, mediocre pay, little to no breaks during workday (they are working to improve this though), challenging behaviors with kiddos, scheduling can be tricky

pros: Flex hours as therapist and or clinician.
cons: Very POOR training, management really are unprofessional, a lot of behind the scenes of cussing and swearing, legally, probably sexual discrimination.  Upper management will blame lack of things not being completed when it was management who did not complete the job in the first place! Must fight and argue for last paycheck and LOA hours.  I got tired of the fight and walked away from my earned LOA hours, wasn't worth the fight.

pros: The upper management and HR supervisor were good people. Time off was given when requested. Flexible with school schedules
cons: Sometimes there was disorganization and a lack of communication but this was often due to them being incredible overwhelmed and understaffed at times.

pros: Ample vacation time. Online data collection and schedulin. Flexible schedules. Bi-weekly clinical meetings. Small caseload and low billable requirement.
cons: Heavy social work lean sometimes interferes with implementation of ABA therapy. Not quite competitive with other coampnies in terms of benefits.

pros: This was an extremely difficult company to work for,  Most of the staff were very caring and concerned  regarding the clients but there were many internal issues that were unresolved and very detrimental to the program and the company.
cons:
The management was
capricious 
demanding
dishonest
financially irresponsible
allowed and advocated the physical abuse of staff by clients
high turn over of staff

pros: I work with great staff
cons: Wish we got paid more for what we do. We go over and beyond for the people we serve and the company

review_title: Learning something new all the time!

cons: It can be stressful at times
